refsect1.title: FORMAT
refsect1.para: A dsp (displacement map) file contains sequences of cells (points) comprising a rectangular grid of network unsigned short ints defined in the X-Y plane with each cell's value defining the cell's height above Z = 0. Each cell value ranges from 0 to 65535. The first cell in a dsp file is the lower left corner of the grid of cells. The cells proceed from left-to-right across each row, with rows being written from the bottom to the top of the grid. Grid dimensions are length (number of cells in the X direction) and width (number of cells in the Y direction).
Dsp grids are rectangular but the dimensions cannot be determined by the file size. A common practice is to include grid dimensions in the filename (e.g., dsp-1-20W30L.dsp).
At some time in the future dsp files may get self-typing headers so that parameters such as their dimensions can be automatically determined by using programs.
